title: La Trobe : Traveller Writer Governor
description: The book reveals new perspectives on this often-misunderstood man, who had travelled as a naturalist and writer through Europe, the USA and Mexico, and as a government official in the West Indies, before arriving in Melbourne in 1839 – where he navigated the new colony through the upheavals of the gold rush.The book includes extracts from La Trobe’s personal notebooks and letters and is illustrated with his evocative watercolours, revealing him to be an engaging and versatile ‘man of a thousand occupations’.
author: John                   Barnes
